pullrequest.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

content.raw: The computation savings was felt mostly when adding a 3D LIDAR to the simulation, which we found was near impossible to run with the heightmap collision. I’m fine with reverting if we can’t find another solution soon
content.html: The computation savings was felt mostly when adding a 3D LIDAR to the simulation, which we found was near impossible to run with the heightmap collision. I’m fine with reverting if we can’t find another solution soon

pullrequest.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

content.raw: We can remove the 3D LIDAR for now, we can tackle it later. It sounds more important to have a stable simulation.
content.html: We can remove the 3D LIDAR for now, we can tackle it later. It sounds more important to have a stable simulation.

pullrequest.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

content.raw: My  real concern is that we are not seeing the same behavior here \(NPS\) and there \(OSRF\).  I fully expect is is operator error on my side, but can’t seem to isolate it.  Have done clean repo clones on two machines - in separate workspaces - and still get the issue, which you guys done see.  Hmmm….
content.html: My real concern is that we are not seeing the same behavior here (NPS) and there (OSRF). I fully expect is is operator error on my side, but can’t seem to isolate it. Have done clean repo clones on two machines - in separate workspaces - and still get the issue, which you guys done see. Hmmm….

pullrequest.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

content.raw: I think there are two apt source where gazebo is hosted: the ROS repo \(packages.ros.org\) and the Gazebo repo \([packages.osrfoundation.org](http://packages.osrfoundation.org)\). If you add the other one using [the line form the dockerfile](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/c24ce33eb7fb5914a9c8b6e9eed417df8c90b003/docker/vmrc/Dockerfile#lines-40) the new version should be available. This should definitely be added to the install instructions if this is the case
content.html: I think there are two apt source where gazebo is hosted: the ROS repo (packages.ros.org) and the Gazebo repo (packages.osrfoundation.org). If you add the other one using the line form the dockerfile the new version should be available. This should definitely be added to the install instructions if this is the case

pullrequest.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

content.raw:
Ah Ha!  I think that is it.

Here are some similar instructions to build on for our setup tutorial: [http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install\_ubuntu](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu)

Nice work.

I’ll update the issue and once everything is working I’ll withdraw this PR.
content.html:
Ah Ha! I think that is it.

Here are some similar instructions to build on for our setup tutorial: http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_ubuntu

Nice work.

I’ll update the issue and once everything is working I’ll withdraw this PR.
